channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Boom Supersonic raises $300M to build natural gas turbines for Crusoe data centers
item.description: Crusoe will pay Boom $1.25 billion for more than a gigawatt of generating capacity with deliveries of the turbines starting in 2027.

item.title: PlayStation's 2025 Wrap-Up is here, so you can see how many hours you've sunk into Death Stranding 2
item.description: Sony's 2025 PlayStation Wrap-Up is now available. The recap, which is similar to those from music streaming services, sums up gaming habits from throughout the year. It shows players how many hours they used their PS4 or PS5, what games they played the most, preferred genres, trophy counts and more. These digital cards are shareable on social media, which is kind of the whole point. Nothing says "bragging rights" more than offering definitive proof of how long you spent on a couch grinding in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 or wandering the wasteland in Death Stranding 2. Sony This year, the reca...

item.title: I’m obsessed with Redfin’s AI search
item.description: Look, I'm as fed up as the next guy with AI chatbots stuffed into every app. I don't want to brainstorm coverage options with an LLM every time I renew my car insurance. I'd much rather message a human than a robot to pester FedEx about my missing package. But I have found one scenario […]

item.title: Europol cracks down on violence-as-a-service network
item.description: Almost 200 people were arrested for all kinds of violent acts.

item.title: Instacart Charging Customers Different Prices for Same Products, Study Finds
item.description: Welcome to the surveillance pricing era.

item.title: Amazon’s Ring rolls out controversial, AI-powered facial recognition feature to video doorbells
item.description: Amazon says the Ring feature is opt in and the biometric data isn't used to train AI models.

item.title: ‘Avatar: Fire and Ash’ Isn’t About Spectacle, It’s About Family
item.description: io9 spoke with several members of the cast of the upcoming 'Avatar' sequel, who dove deep into the real-world implications of their characters.

item.title: The best gifts for dads that have everything (but deserve more)
item.description: What do you get the man who says he has everything? It's a tough question - and one you have a limited amount of time to answer, given the holidays are nearly upon us. You could try dropping subtle hints or asking friends and family for suggestions, but they might save their best ideas for […]

item.title: The best deals on MacBooks right now
item.description: Apple currently sells MacBooks equipped with its own M-series processors in a wide range of sizes and price points, all of which run the company’s new operating system, macOS 26. The latest 14-inch MacBook Pro that debuted in October 2025 features the M5 processor, its fastest and most efficient yet, and it’s already $250 off […]

item.title: Nothing’s community-designed Phone 3A adds some color and matching dice
item.description: The Nothing Phone 3A Community Edition revamps Nothing's usual monochrome look with a 90s-inspired design infused by pops of color. It's updating the basic 3A's transparent backplate with a teal tint, plus yellow and magenta buttons. They're also throwing in an accessory too, for the first time, adding a limited edition set of six-sided dice […]

item.title: Truecaller now lets users protect households from scam calls
item.description: Truecaller's Family Protection will be rolled out widely in the first quarter of 2026. The new feature lets up to five people join a family group overseen by one member who acts as the administrator and manages scam-blocking settings for the others.

item.title: Facebook’s redesign is making it more like Instagram
item.description: Continuing CEO Mark Zuckerberg's plan to make Facebook "way more culturally influential than it is today," Meta is announcing a bunch of new updates to help you "cut through the clutter" and make content in the app. The changes include tweaks to how you see and interact with photos in your feed that could make […]

item.title: OpenAI Hires Slack CEO as New Chief Revenue Officer
item.description: A memo obtained by WIRED confirms Denise Dresser's departure from Slack. She is now headed to OpenAI.

item.title: Australia boots kids under 16 off social media: how platforms are responding
item.description: Australia is joining a wave of governments around the globe in regulating how kids spend their time online. On December 10th, most major social media platforms will boot children in the country under 16 from their services. Under the law, social platforms will also need to implement a "reasonable" age verification method there - while […]

item.title: Trump heads to Pennsylvania rally on the affordability crisis. Here’s what to know
item.description: President Trump claims he’s given consumers relief through easing fuel standards, reducing drug prices, and more—while denying responsibility for inflation. President Donald Trump will road-test his claims that he’s tackling Americans’ affordability woes at a Tuesday rally in Mount Pocono, Pennsylvania—shifting an argument made in Oval Office appearances and social media posts to a campaign-style event....

item.title: RAM price hikes: the latest on the global memory shortage
item.description: Random access memory, or RAM, is in just about every piece of technology we use. But it’s also the technology that AI companies like OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, and Meta are using to power the servers in their massive data centers. Now, the world’s biggest memory makers — Samsung, SK Hynix, and Micron — are taking […]

item.title: The Sun Survived a Close Call With 2 Massive Stars 4.4 Million Years Ago, Data Shows
item.description: The encounter left behind a trace in the clouds of gas and dust surrounding our solar system.

item.title: DOT offers $1B for airports to add nursing suites, family lanes, and even treadmills
item.description: The DOT says the money can support nursing mothers, expanded family security lanes, and even terminal workout stations. The Department of Transportation (DOT) has created a new $1 billion grant program to make U.S. airports more family- and health-friendly.

item.title: Pixel Watch 4 : Google copie le geste génial d’Apple
item.description: Vous en aviez marre de toucher votre écran avec le nez quand vous aviez les mains prises ? Google a la solution. La mise à jour de décembre apporte le contrôle gestuel et des réponses dopées à l'IA Gemma sur la Pixel Watch 4.

item.title: The Best Karaoke Speakers from Small and Portable to Massive
item.description: Looking to make karaoke night a regular thing? We’ve tested everything from Bluetooth speakers to full-blown PAs.

item.title: Fed likely to lower rate but may pause follow-up cuts
item.description: Most economists expect the Fed will reduce rates, while also signaling that it may stand pat for some time to assess the economy’s health. The Federal Reserve faces an unusually contentious meeting this week that will test Chair Jerome Powell‘s ability to corral the necessary support from fellow policymakers for a third straight interest rate cut.

item.title: Ford and Renault team up on cheaper EVs in a ‘fight for our lives’
item.description: The automakers will work together to bring two Ford-branded EVs to European dealerships in 2028.

item.title: Google Photos’ new video editor makes it more like Capcut
item.description: The Google Photos app on Android and iOS is getting a video editing overhaul with a redesigned editor, templates for highlight reels, and options for adding custom text overlays and music to individual videos. Highlight reels, which automatically cut together a video featuring selected photos and videos, were already part of Google Photos, but now […]...

item.title: From ‘Sinners’ to ‘Frankenstein,’ 2025 Put Twins All Over the Movies
item.description: You may not have realized it while watching movies like 'Sinners' and 'Superman,' but twins were on Hollywood's 2025 agenda.

item.title: Google Photos launches new video editing tools
item.description: Google Photos' new update helps make editing video reels in the app quicker, such as new templates that already add music and text to clips.

item.title: Grab 16GB of DDR5 RAM at the cheapest price in the UK before it's gone — Crucial DDR5-5600 memory is just £66 on Amazon
item.description: Grab 16GB of Crucial DDR5 5600MHz RAM for just £66, but be quick, it won't be around for long.

item.title: Samsung One UI 8.5 : la bêta est officiellement lancée, voici les nouveautés de la mise à jour
item.description: La bêta de la mise à jour One UI 8.5 est officiellement lancée. Voici les nouveautés ainsi que les smartphones et pays concernés.

item.title: JMGO’s new, feature-packed portable 4K projector is surprisingly cheap — but only for a limited time
item.description: JMGO's short-throw projector is very bright and comes packed with features

item.title: Skyrim arrives on the Switch 2
item.description: You can add the Switch 2 to the (long) list of platforms where you can play The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim. The bad news: It costs $60 to play the 2011 game optimized for Nintendo's 2025 hardware. The good news: It costs less (or nothing) if you own one of the versions for the original Switch. The (digital-only) Switch 2 port is the Anniversary Edition of Skyrim, released in 2021. That includes the base game and three expansions (Dawnguard, Dragonborn and Hearthfire). You'll also find hundreds of Creation Club items, like quests, weapons, armor, spells and dungeons. The Anniversary Edition's Zeld...

item.title: Data center construction moratorium is gaining steam
item.description: More than 230 groups including Food & Water Watch, Physicians for Social Responsibility, and Greenpeace are demanding a pause on the construction of any new data centers in the US until stronger regulations are in place to prevent soaring electricity rates, water use, and pollution. "The rapid, largely unregulated rise of data centers to fuel […]

item.title: NASA and USPS stop using Canoo EVs despite CEO’s pledged support
item.description: Canoo's CEO bought the bankrupt startup's assets in April and told the court his "principal motivation" was supporting these programs.

item.title: Trump vows to block state AI regulations, calling them a threat to innovation
item.description: With little federal oversight in place, safety groups say eliminating state authority could leave Americans vulnerable to bias, deepfakes, and unsafe systems. President Donald Trump just announced that he plans to issue an executive order this week to set federal rules around artificial intelligence—and prevent states from setting their own.

item.title: The Apple Mac Mini deal from Black Friday has returned: Save $120 on the M4 model
item.description: The Apple M4 Mac Mini is back down to its Black Friday price of $479 at Amazon and Best Buy. Save $120 while you can.

item.title: Microsoft Flight Sim 2024 now has a Stranger Things expansion
item.description: Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 just got a fairly bizarre expansion inspired by the Netflix show Stranger Things. If you've ever wanted to fly over a fictional Indiana town in the 1980s, this is the update for you. That's right. The game now lets folks fly over Hawkins, Indiana and check out more than 40 iconic locations from the series, including Starcourt Mall, the junkyard, the government lab and, of course, the upside down. Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 introduces Netflix’s Stranger Things expansion, out Dec 9📡 Recreation of Hawkins with more than 40 iconic locations🚁 Five exhilarating m...

item.title: “Un gaspillage inutile de ressources” : ce patron chinois remet en cause la mode des voitures électriques avec moteur essence qui arrivent en Europe
item.description: Alors que les constructeurs chinois rivalisent pour équiper leurs véhicules hybrides de batteries toujours plus imposantes, le président d'Onvo, la marque abordable de Nio, va à contre-courant. Pour lui, ces énormes batteries sont avant tout un gaspillage de ressources.

item.title: OpenAI Staffer Quits, Alleging Company’s Economic Research Is Drifting Into AI Advocacy
item.description: Four sources close to the situation claim OpenAI has become hesitant to publish research on the negative impact of AI. The company says it has only expanded the economic research team’s scope.

item.title: More people crowdfunded basic needs in 2025, GoFundMe report shows
item.description: The number of ‘essentials’ fundraisers on GoFundMe has increased over the last three years in all of the company’s major English-speaking markets. More and more people are turning to GoFundMe for help covering the cost of housing, food, and other basic needs.

item.title: Vous cherchez un smartphone à 100 euros ? Notre sélection
item.description: En 2025, il est difficile de trouver un smartphone correct à moins de 100 euros sans abonnement téléphonique. Nous avons fait le tri pour vous aider à trouver le meilleur téléphone possible à tout petit prix en 2025.

item.title: OpenAI, Anthropic, and Block join new Linux Foundation effort to standardize the AI agent era
item.description: Anthropic, Block, and OpenAI are backing the Linux Foundation’s new Agentic AI Foundation, donating MCP, Goose, and AGENTS.md to standardize AI agents, boost interoperability, and curb proprietary fragmentation.

item.title: Wreak holiday havoc with 50% off the The Grinch Christmas Adventures on Switch
item.description: As of Dec. 9, get The Grinch Christmas Adventures for 50% off at Amazon.

item.title: Tiny Robot Lost Under Antarctic Ice for 8 Months Comes Back With Rare Data
item.description: “Against the enormity of such a wild region, this is an amazing story of the little float that could.”

item.title: Trump set to allow Nvidia H200 chips to be exported to China
item.description: Nvidia can do some business with China via H200 exports, but Blackwell and Rubin are still banned.

item.title: Meta is trying to make Facebook suck less by simplifying things a bit
item.description: Somewhere along its never-ending quest to increase engagement, Meta realized that giving Facebook users more of what they want would make it more likely that they'll stick around. The company has announced a bunch of updates designed to help improve the feed and the broader Facebook experience by making it easier to find, create and share interesting things. (Because primarily showing updates from your friends with the occasional ad or meme post is maybe just too complicated.)Simplification is a big focus of this overhaul. First, the Facebook feed will be a bit more streamlined. Whenever you p...
